conclusion: Determine the frictional force acting on the wire frame at t = 2.5 seconds.
A single-turn square wire frame is placed on a horizontal surface with half in a magnetic field.
Calculate the area of the wire frame in the magnetic field: A = 0.02 m^2.
Determine the induced current: I = 0.01 A.
Calculate the magnetic force: F = 0.016 N.
Determine the frictional force: F_f = 0.016 N.
Determine the direction of the frictional force: to the right.
Final answer: The magnitude of the frictional force is 0.016 N, direction is to the right.
